abstract.text: Creates a message with the specified content and an optional service name.

The identifier of the conversation that contains this message.
The text that Siri recites to the message recipient.
The date and time the app sent the message to each recipient.
The person who sent the message.
The people who recieved the message.

Use the
parameter to associate individual messages with a larger discussion among a specific group of people.
For each participant in the message (sender and recipients), create an instance of
using one of the initializers that require an
parameter. Use
for the participant that represents the user of the current device; for all other participants, use
. When creating each of those objects, provide enough information for you to later identify that same person.
If your app supports more than one message service, specify the
parameter to indicate which service the app uses to deliver a specific message.

abstract.text: Empower people to customize interactions for your app on their device.
An object that describes a sent or received message.
Creates a message with the specified content.
Creates a message with the specified content and an optional group name.
Creates a message with the specified content and an optional service name.
Creates a message with the specified content and an optional audio message file.
Creates a message of a distinct type with the specified content.
Constants that describe the kinds of content a message can contain.
Information about a person participating in a SiriKit interaction.
A custom phrase to be resolved by an Intents extension.
A representation of a specific point in time, for use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A specific point in time, independent of any calendar or time zone.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
